title: How to Fry Deer Steak

steps.headline: Use a good black iron skillet.
Use a palm type ingredient, or something similar, to keep the meat from sticking.
Use well tenderized pieces of meat.
steps.description: It does not need to be marinated.

steps.headline: Dip and cover the meat with bread crumbs.
Heat the skillet to medium heat.
Place the meat into the skillet.
Quick fry the meat on both sides until browned.
Bring the heat to a simmer (low heat).
Add 1 or 2 cups of water to the skillet, depending on its size.
Cover it with a lid for about half an hour.
steps.description: Be sure to check it periodically.

steps.headline: Remove the lid and turn the heat up.
Quick fry it until the water evaporates.

text: Use a good black iron skillet.  Use a palm type ingredient, or something similar, to keep the meat from sticking.  Use well tenderized pieces of meat. It does not need to be marinated. Dip and cover the meat with bread crumbs.  Heat the skillet to medium heat.  Place the meat into the skillet.  Sprinkle meat well with seasoning.  Quick fry the meat on both sides until browned.  Bring the heat to a simmer (low heat).  Add 1 or 2 cups of water to the skillet, depending on its size.  Cover it with a lid for about half an hour. Be sure to check it periodically. Remove the lid and turn the heat up.  Quick fry it until the water evaporates.  Serve.
